content.description:
An interesting slab climb on friable holds. Climb the left trending face features leads to some harder moves on rails towards the top.

Groundfall potential for the initial climbing due to the traversing nature.
content.location: Climb the face features below and to the right of the Find's anchors.

content.description: Starts with chossy climbing and .3 size crack. Then goes small hands to bigger than fists. Start seemed hard to me 10+/11-.
content.protection: Single set with maybe 2 .3s, 2 3s, 2 4s, and I think a 5 might go.
content.location: Next route right of sad saddam.

climbs.name: Tear Gas
climbs.fa: Alex Garhart, Daniel Garman and Toni Walters, April, 2010

content.description: Climb twin cracks off the ground to a thin hands splitter that narrows to tips.  A little manky in places.
content.protection: Ballnuts, BD C3's, 2 each of #0.3-0.75 camalots.  Chain anchor.
content.location: Right of Shock and Awe ~2 minutes.

content.description: Climb thin hands to hands and bit of offwidth right below the chains in a left facing corner.  Excellent stone.
content.location: Right of where the approach trail meets the crag ~5 minutes.

content.description: Good offset baggy fingers crack. Decent feet on the right. Book says 11, more like 11-. Fun route.
content.protection: 3-4 .5s, 2-3 .4s, 1-2 .75, could use a .3 at the top
content.location: A ways down the right side of the crag, one of the last routes.

content.description: This route starts with a few feet of choss at the bottom to get into a fun stem-box. Pull the awesome reach around moves to get to an easier fingers and hands section with ledges. The top of the crack pinches down to tips and smaller (crux) and the rock gets a little softer and sandier. One of the better routes at the cliff and the stem-box/reach-around bit is rather unique.
content.protection:
Black alien/purple C3 up to a #2 camalot. Heavy on blue-green alien and/or green-red C3 sizes.

The anchor is two good bolts with webbing and fixed carabiners. The bolts are vertically offset by about 6" and the addition of some chain and links would be great if you're so inclined.

Note on route length: the book calls this one 100' but says you need a 70m rope. We had a 70m rope and I don't remember how much was left when we climbed it. Proceed with caution if using a 60m!
content.location: Located on the right side of the cliff, right of Shock & Awe and Tear Gas and a good ways left of Sad Saddam.

climbs.name: The Find
climbs.fa: Karl Kelley and Heidi Stanke, May 2016

content.description: A right facing arch with a #1 crack followed by an improbable looking roof traverse with a great foot rail.
content.location: Located much futher in the canyon the rest of the climbs at Shock and Awe. Stay in the wash before the talus for another 30 minutes until you see the right-facing arch.

content.description: This route starts in a bit of lower quality rock with a drilled angle. Climb 10ft through this to get to a finger crack in an acute left facing tight corner. Climb off fingers to a pod with jams above and then pull onto the headwall sinking bomber tight hands to the anchor where the crack pinches back down to off fingers.
content.protection: 1 QD, .4 - #2 doubles + in the off fingers stuff! Anchor is two drilled anchors easy to back up for a TR with a #2 or .75
content.location: Look for the drilled angle, this route is left of the trail that use to approach the wall.
